title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
OB: When creating a package with a compilation unit (CU) and making the CU readonly, the software allows an attempt to rename the package. After the renaming process is completed, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
EB: The software should check if all resources, including the compilation unit, are writeable before allowing the renaming of a package. If any resource is marked as readonly, the software should prevent the renaming process and display an appropriate error message.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a package with a compilation unit.
2. Make the compilation unit readonly.
3. Attempt to rename the package.
4. Observe the unexpected exception dialog after the renaming process is completed.
